thread.title: Defense provides right formula for Central
thread.title_full: Defense provides right formula for Central - PrepXtra Story

author: Victor Lee
title: Defense provides right formula for Central
text:
Central High School defensive coordinator Larry Slade, a former University of Tennessee assistant coach, keeps dialing up winning formulas for the Bobcats.
Senior defensive tackle Alex Norris intercepted a screen pass and returned it 42 yards to set up one score, and Rondrow Peebles returned an interception for a touchdown Friday night as Central defeated Halls 48-14 in a non-conference rivalry game at Central.
The game was delayed 1 hour, 40 minutes by lightning.
“My teammate tipped the ball on the interception, and I had to make it,” Peebles said. “On the sack, I told coach, ‘I got you, just send me on the blitz.’ Our defense is carrying a lot of confidence now. We feel we can stop any offense at any time.”
Central (6-1) appeared close to putting Halls (3-4) away early, but the Red Devils wouldn’t go down easy.
Matthew Runge-Gold was a big reason. The junior defensive back and wide receiver scored all of the Red Devils’ points, returning an interception 39 yards and a kickoff 99 yards. Halls had won three in a row, scoring 110 points in the victories, before Friday’s loss and offensive shutout.
The Bobcats’ offense put on a show. Running backs Jeremiah Howard (199 yards on 11 carries) and Jadarius Sackie (133 on 10) ran freely.
Slade’s defense registered its third shutout of the season.
With Central leading 7-0, Halls was threatening to tie the game when Norris stepped in front of a slow developing screen pass at his own 34 and rumbled 42 yards to the Halls 34. Two plays later, Sackie ran 34 yards around left end. Central led 14-0 nine seconds into the second.
Peebles intercepted an Andrew Davis pass 1:13 later and returned it 34 yards for a 21-0 lead.
The Red Devils drove to the Bobcats’ 13, but on fourth-and-13 from the 16, Peebles streaked from the left corner to sack Davis and end the threat.
“We’re excited every time our kids step on the field, especially our defense,” Central coach Bryson Rosser said. “Especially our defense. They give us a chance in every game.”
Victor Lee is a freelance contributor.
Central 48, Halls 14
Halls 0 14 0 0 — 14
Central 7 21 7 13 — 48
Scoring: C — Jadarius Sackie 9 run (Eli Holbert kick); Sackie 34 run (Holbert kick); Rondrow Peebles 34 interception return (Holbert kick); Riley Gaul 9 run (Holbert kick); H — Briggs Marcentel 99 kick return (Matthew Rontetold kick); Marcentel 26 interception return (Rontetold kick); C — Sackie 16 run (Holbert kick); Jeremiah Howard 5 run (Holbert kick); Craig Burt 6 run (kick failed)
Records: Halls 4-3, Central 6-1
